title: La Gazette de café du cycliste

elements.title: Ride of the Month: November.
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: November. A ride that goes further than the normal nourishing experience, climbing the iconic Col d’Eze en route to Monaco in search of a model turned urban gardener. The principality isn’t classicly urban and certainly not suburban but it is on the rooftops of Monaco that Jessica grows her organic produce.

elements.title: Norway on Film AW21
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

Norway on Film AW21 The road may be long, the terrain may be tough but the results are spectacular. Shot the old fashioned way for a place where time stands still.

elements.title: A Mont-Blanc Gravel Tour with Etienne Hubert.
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

A Mont-Blanc Gravel Tour with Etienne Hubert. After the last few months of training and the Olympics in Japan, I find myself constantly craving nature. I’ve thought about doing a Gravel tour of Mont Blanc for so long, so this seemed like the perfect time.

elements.title: Atelier Lookbook AW21.
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

Atelier Lookbook AW21. Uniquely styled, the collection mirrors the freedom of the road within the design and development process itself. Fewer rules, less restriction, more freedom.

elements.title: I am not a number 38.
elements.contents:
FILMS

I am not a number 38. As an Olympic sailor, Haffi understands the pressure that comes with competing at the highest level but for him, nothing compares to the intensity of racing on two wheels.

elements.title: AW21: Serre Chevalier Lookbook
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

AW21: Serre Chevalier Lookbook Outdoors is out there. Before and after the bike, between and among the hills. New Arrière-Pays pieces for AW21 inspired by the back country around Nice.

elements.title: Badlands: The Ultra Distance Gravel Race.
elements.contents:
ROULER

Badlands: The Ultra Distance Gravel Race. Sophie Gateau tackles Badlands, an unsupported off-road race through Andalusia, made up of around 725km and 15,000m of altitude gain.

elements.title: Ride of the Month: October.
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: October. In October 2020, Storm Alex hit the valleys in the hinterland around Nice and the whole landscape was permanently altered. Chris returns one year later.

elements.title: Tracks and Trails in the Ariège.
elements.contents:
ROULER

Tracks and Trails in the Ariège. Five friends explore routes shared with the incredibly diverse range of four legged and airborne residents of the Ariège by bike.

elements.title: Guillaume Néry: A Traverse Across the Pyrenees
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Guillaume Néry: A Traverse Across the Pyrenees Each summer, I set off on an adventurous trip with good friends who are up for a challenge. Last year, we bikepacked through the Alps and this year we tackled the Pyrenees.

elements.title: Roc d'Azur: The CDC Gravel Team.
elements.contents:
ROULER

Roc d'Azur: The CDC Gravel Team. At Café du Cycliste we really like gravel and so we have formed the ‘True Grit’ Café du Cycliste team. Three fierce female riders, Holly, Charlotte and Maria, take on one of the greatest gravel events in the world.

elements.title: I am not a number 06.
elements.contents:
FILMS

I am not a number 06. Alexia is the 10th woman in the world among nearly 100 skippers to have finished the Vendée Globe race without stopping and without assistance. Cycling is her other passion.
